item.title: Nine Games Leaving Xbox Game Pass On November 30
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nine-games-leaving-xbox-game-pass-on-november-30/

Nine more games are leaving the Xbox Game Pass library this month. None of the games being removed are major AAA titles, but there are some noticeable games leaving, including Conan Exiles, Remnant: From The Ashes, and Hello Neighbor 2.

The games leaving come as Microsoft has announced its second wave of games being added to the service in November, including Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl and Nine Sols.

HELP INSIDER GAMING: Take Our 2024 Reader Survey

As usual with games leaving the service, players who want to continue playing them can get 20% off the purchase price with their Game Pass membership. You can check out the full list of games leaving the service, below.

All games will be removed on November 30.

Games Leaving Xbox Game Pass

  • Conan Exiles (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Coral Island (PC)
  • Hello Neighbor 2 (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Remnant: From The Ashes (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Rollerdrome (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Soccer Story (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Spirit of the North (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • The Walking Dead: The Final Season (PC)
  • While the Iron’s Hot (Cloud, Console, and PC)

What do you think of the games leaving Xbox Game Pass on November 30? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what one insider had to say after they saw an Alpha build of Fable. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

Xbox Game Pass Wave 2 Titles For November 2024 Revealed

Microsoft has announced the second wave of games coming to Xbox Game Pass for November 2024 starting November 20.

Fable Alpha Gameplay Footage Details Revealed by Insider

According to Industry Insider, Fable’s alpha gameplay footage consists of “CD Projekt Red DNA.” Here are more details.

Inaugural Indie Game Awards Announce Full List Of Nominees

Ahead of its inaugural show on December 19, The Indie Game Awards have announced its full list of nominees for 2024.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 List of Known Issues (UPDATED)

Developers Treyarch and Raven Software have released a list of the known issues in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Wave 2 Titles For November 2024 Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-game-pass-wave-2-titles-for-november-2024-revealed/

Microsoft has announced the next wave of games coming to Xbox Game Pass in November 2024. Coming over the next week are Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl, PlateUp!, Nine Sols, Aliens Dark Descent, and Little Kitty, Big City.

Three games join the service on November 20 including Little Kitty, Big City, PlateUp!, and Stalker 2. Stalker 2 is a day one release for the service on Game Pass Ultimate and PC. Nine Sols arrives on November 26 and is also just for Ultimate and PC subscribers. Lastly, Aliens: Dark Descent arrives for all Game Pass subscribers on November 27.

PlateUp! and Little Kitty, Big City will also be available for Game Pass Standard subscribers on console. Lastly, Microsoft Flight Simulator is available for PC and Ultimate members starting today, November 19.

Aside from the new games to the service, Microsoft revealed that Genshin Impact players will receive two Intertwined Fate, one Northlander Billet Trove, 10 Hero’s Wit, 100,000 Mora, and 15 Mystic Enhancement Ore. The rewards come in celebration of the game’s release on Xbox Series consoles.

What do you think of the five new games coming to Xbox and PC Game Pass in November 2024? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the full list of nominees for the inaugural Indie Game Awards. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Fable Alpha Gameplay Footage Details Revealed by Insider
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fable-alpha-gameplay-footage-details-revealed-by-insider/

Reliable industry insider Jez Corden has revealed details about Fable’s alpha gameplay footage, indicating that the game’s style is similar to CD Projekt Red’s.

In the latest episode of The Xbox Two podcast (as shared by ZakkenKloot on X), Jez Corden discussed seeing some alpha gameplay footage for Fable and expressed his excitement by describing it as “fantastic.” However, Corden is uncertain about the timeline for this alpha build.

Corden discusses how the alpha gameplay footage of Fable contains elements reminiscent of “CD Projekt Red DNA.” He explains that Playground Games has hired several developers from CD Projekt Red, including a combat designer.

From the combat footage, he can identify where the inspiration originates. While the gameplay isn’t an exact replica of The Witcher, it features similar mechanics. Furthermore, the footage looks “super polished” for an alpha build.

Moreover, Corden revealed that Fable’s alpha gameplay footage showcased various weapon types, including bows and arrows, spells, and melee weapons—similar to those used by Geralt. He also discusses the design of certain enemy types, featuring comedic and frightening elements for chickens and werewolves. Overall, he felt that the gameplay looked impressive, and the combat was “very tight” for an alpha build.

In other news, Alan Wake 2 has sold over 1.8 million copies. Also, Pokemon TCG Pocket reportedly surpassed $120 million in earnings. What are your thoughts on Fable’s alpha gameplay footage? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Inaugural Indie Game Awards Announce Full List Of Nominees. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Inaugural Indie Game Awards Announce Full List Of Nominees
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/inaugural-indie-game-awards-announce-full-list-of-nominees/

The Indie Game Awards have announced the full list of award categories and nominees for its inaugural show on December 19.

In total, there are 15 awards up for grabs at the event with 63 games vying for awards in music, gameplay design, innovation, narrative, and more. Two awards, Storyteller and Industry Impact, didn’t have a list of nominees announced. Instead, those two awards will be announced specifically during The Indie Game Awards show.

“Narrowing down 365 days of remarkable indie games across the 15 categories was a gargantuan task for our curation jury,” The Indie Game Awards co-creator Mike Towndrow told Insider Gaming. “But the list we’ve landed on is a killer reflection of how much the indie scene has stepped up this year.

He added: “Take the Game of the Year category, for example. Those 10 games represent an incredibly diverse range of elements we all look for when discussing some of the greatest games of all time. They’re a perfect snapshot of how indies continue to push the boundaries and drive the industry forward.”

As mentioned, Game of the Year, the biggest award of the show, has 10 games nominated. Those games include 1000xRESIST, ARCO, Animal Well, Balatro, Lorelei and the Laser Eyes, Neva, Nine Sols, UFO 50, Mouthwashing, and Crypt Custodian.

“Our goal is for The Indie Game Awards to become the definitive annual celebration of the indie scene,” Towndrow said. “That endgame vision is made possible through the deep collaboration we’ve built with fellow indie showcases, organizations, journalists, content creators, and, of course, the developers themselves.

“And this is just the beginning. We’re more motivated than ever to expand that collaboration and scale, bringing even more individuals into the fold to make The IGAs a staple of the indie scene—a celebration that breaks through into the wider gaming industry.”

You can check out the full list of nominees below. Insider Gaming will have full coverage of The Indie Game Awards when they air on December 19 at 7pm ET.

The Indie Game Awards Nominees

Game of the Year

  • 1000xRESIST
  • Animal Well
  • ARCO
  • Balatro
  • Crypt Custodian
  • Lorelei and the Laser Eyes
  • Mouthwashing

  • Nine Sols
  • UFO 50
